raw_text:
Owen determined to stay in Madrid
 
 England forward Michael Owen has told the BBC he is happy in Spain and has no plans to quit Real Madrid to return to the Premiership in the near future.
 
 But the 25-year-old, who has spent much of his time coming off the bench in La Liga, did not rule out a return to the Premiership at some stage. "I'm pleased with the start I've made here," he told BBC Radio Five Live. "England is my country. It's definitely part of me but who knows whether, if or when I'll be playing there again." Owen, who moved to the Bernabeu from Liverpool last summer, has grabbed 11 goals for Real but has been unable to replace Raul or Ronaldo in the starting line-up. However, he said he was delighted with the way his time in Spain was going and dismissed criticism of his decision to join Real. "When I first came there was a lot of scepticism back in England, any maybe some out here," he said. "People were saying 'fourth-choice striker, what are you going there for? You'll be sat on the bench all the time'.
 
 "But as much as our press like to build it up as if I've permanently had my backside on the bench, I've played as many games as anyone else in the team this year. "For a fourth-choice striker at the start I'm more than happy with the way I've settled in." Recent speculation has linked Owen with a move back to England, with Newcastle expressing their interest, but the England striker said he is not ready to return home. He added: "I've got nothing against the Premiership, I mean that's where I first performed, that's where I made my name.
 
 "I can't keep my eyes off the Premiership on television when I'm at home." When asked if it would have to be Liverpool if he returned Owen said: "I've not really given it much thought. "I've got great memories of Liverpool. No matter what happens it'll always be a club I have fond memories of and it will always have a place in my heart. "It's very flattering to be linked to top clubs in England - I'm glad that no-one is forgetting me! "But I couldn't have wished for a better start in Madrid."
 
 - Listen to the full interview with Garry Richardson on BBC Radio Five Live's Sportsweek at 0900 GMT on Sunday.
llama3.2:1b: Michael Owen has told the BBC he is happy in Spain and has no plans to return to England, but does not rule out returning to the Premiership at some stage.
llama3.2:3b: Michael Owen says he is happy in Spain and has no plans to quit Real Madrid, but does not rule out a return to the Premiership in the future, calling it "my country" and stating he can't keep his eyes off it when watching on TV, saying Liverpool would be an option if he returned.
gemma2:2b: Michael Owen, after playing with Real Madrid, has no intention of returning to England's Premiership anytime soon. He is happy with his current situation in Spain and considers himself a "fourth-choice striker" but still finds contentment there despite limited playing time. While he acknowledges Newcastle's interest, Owen remains committed to his current path in Madrid.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Owen, now playing as an England forward, has remained at La Liga club Real Madrid despite leaving Liverpool. He is happy in Spain and hopes to return home once he can play for the Premiership team. Owen was disappointed with his time in Spain, but said he feels better now that things are settled in.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Owen remains with Real Madrid, despite criticism from England fans and speculation about returning to the Premier League. He is happy with his performance and prefers not to return home due to fond memories of Liverpool.
qwen2.5:3b: England forward Michael Owen has decided to stay in Spain and is happy with his current stint at Real Madrid, despite being mostly used as a substitute in La Liga. At 25, he has scored 11 goals for the club but does not play in the starting lineup due to the absence of Raul and Cristiano Ronaldo. Although he dismissed criticism about joining Real Madrid, Owen stated he is not ready to return home, though Newcastle expressed interest. He believes his time at Madrid so far has been satisfactory and acknowledges his strong ties with Liverpool as a former club where he made his name, but also recognizes the appeal of playing in England’s top league.

smollm:1.7b:
The summary should be:
Owen determined to stay in Madrid because England is his country and he has no plans to return to the Premiership in the near future.
deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Alright, so I need to summarize this text about Owen staying in Spain and thinking about returning to England. Let me read through it again.

Owen is from England and told the BBC he's happy in Spain but not ruling out a return next year or something. He said he hasn't changed much since moving to Spain, playing on the bench sometimes. He's had 11 goals for Real but can't replace Raul or Ronaldo starting line-up. He's happy with his time there and even criticized some comments about being on the bench, saying they're unnecessary.

He mentions how when he was in England, people were skeptical, thinking he was a fourth-choice striker all the time. But as an interner, he's okay with that because he played a lot of games. He also linked his future moves to England and the possibility of staying at Manchester United if he wanted.

Owen is happy about playing for Madrid but doesn't rule out returning home. He even wants to keep memories of Liverpool positive. So I need to capture all these points in a concise summary without any extra info or explanations.

Let me make sure I include his current situation, past experiences, and future plans. That should cover the key ideas.
</think>

Owen, an England forward, is currently happy in Spain, stating he won't quit Real Madrid to return to the Premiership. He played on the bench often but dominated as an interner. With 11 goals, he's content with his time there and acknowledged some criticism about being stuck on the bench initially. He prefers staying at Manchester United if needed. He's positive about playing for Madrid but is open to returning home, especially since he has fond memories of Liverpool.
tinyllama:1.1b: Owen determined to stay in Madrid while England forward Michael Owen has no plans to return to the Premier League club, "for a fourth-choice striker at the start," he is happy with his current status and has been consistent during his time in Spain with Real Madrid. The 25-year-old who joined the club from Liverpool last summer has caught the eye of Newcastle as they expressed interest in him but Owen believes he is not ready to return home for the Premier League, "I've got nothing against it and can't keep my eyes off television when I'm at home," he said. Despite his success with Real Madrid, Owen has not ruled out a potential return to England in the future, but noted that he currently enjoys playing for Real Madrid and is content with his current status.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Michael Owen, who has played for both Manchester United and Liverpool, is enjoying his life in Spain but also considering whether he can return to England for a more significant role. The 25-year-old forward expressed excitement about starting his second season at Real Madrid but admitted there's still room for growth as a player. He also gave credit to the team management and staff for helping him adapt to life in Spain. However, Owen remains hopeful of returning to England in the future, with Newcastle expressing interest in signing him back home.
phi:2.7b: Michael Owen, an England forward who has moved from Liverpool to Real Madrid, is happy in Spain and has no plans to return to the Premiership. However, he did not rule out a return in the future. He played 11 goals for Real but has been unable to replace Raul or Ronaldo in the starting line-up. Despite recent speculation of him returning to England, Owen said he was more than happy with his time in Spain and dismissed criticism of his decision to join Real.
orca-mini:3b: Owen determined to stay in Madrid despite recent speculation linking him with a move back to England.
hermes3:3b: Michael Owen plans to stay in Madrid, happy in Spain & Real Madrid; not ready to return to Premiership.
stablelm-zephyr:3b:
English footballer Michael Owen, who currently plays for Real Madrid and is the England forward, has stated that he is content with his current situation in Spain and does not intend to return to the English Premier League any time soon. However, he did not rule out a possible return to the Premiership at some point in the future. Despite being primarily considered a substitute player during his time in La Liga, Owen has managed to score 11 goals for Real Madrid, though he has yet to displace Raul or Ronaldo as a starting choice.

Owen dismissed criticisms that initially greeted his move to Real Madrid with skepticism in England, suggesting that people questioned whether he would be content sitting on the bench. He proudly proclaimed that he had played more games than any other teammate this year and was happy with how his assimilation into Spanish football had progressed.

While recent speculations linked Owen to a potential return to Newcastle, an English Premiership team, he dismissed such ideas as not ready yet. Despite having fond memories of playing for Liverpool, which is where he began his professional career, Owen expressed gratitude for the opportunity and maintained that his heart always resides in England. However, at present, Owen feels content with Real Madrid, appreciating every moment spent there.
chatgpt-4o-latest: Michael Owen has stated he is happy at Real Madrid and has no immediate plans to return to the Premiership, though he does not rule out a future move. Despite starting as a fourth-choice striker, he is pleased with his progress, having scored 11 goals and played regularly. He dismissed criticism of his decision to join Real Madrid and expressed satisfaction with his time in Spain. While speculation links him to a return to England, including interest from Newcastle, Owen remains focused on Madrid. He acknowledges his strong connection to Liverpool but has not seriously considered a return. He appreciates being linked to top English clubs but is content with his current situation.
stablelm2:1.6b: England forward Michael Owen has decided to stay in Spain, after expressing happiness in his current situation with Real Madrid. Despite playing as a bench player during his time with Liverpool, he has played numerous games this season for Real Madrid and is satisfied with the start he's made. He hasn't ruled out returning to England at some point but currently does not plan on leaving Madrid. Owen expresses fond memories of both Liverpool and the Premiership in general, but acknowledges that it's a place where he made his name.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Michael Owen, a 25-year-old England forward for Real Madrid, expressed contentment in his Spanish life and dismissed rumors of an imminent return to the Premiership. Despite limited playing time as a substitute, he has scored 11 goals since joining from Liverpool last summer. Owen acknowledged initial skepticism about his decision but emphasized his active involvement in games and satisfaction with his integration into Real Madrid's team. Though Newcastle is reportedly interested in him, Owen remains committed to his current club. He reiterated that while he values his Premiership roots and Liverpool history, he's not considering a move back to England for now.
